text: Grevillea psilantha is a shrub of the genus Grevillea native to a small area in the Kimberley region of Western Australia. The many branched shrub typically grows to a height of and has non-glaucous branchlets. It has simple linear undissected flat leaves with a blade that is long and wide. It blooms from April to July and produces a terminal raceme irregular inflorescence with white flowers and styles. Later it forms obovoid glabrous fruit that is long. ==See also== * List of Grevillea species ==References== psilantha Category:Proteales of Australia Category:Eudicots of Western Australia
title: Grevillea psilantha
